inn1.comm: good length, outside off at 143 kph, de Silva picks the line early and leaves
full, straight, flicks, misses. Too pacy - 146 kph - for de Silva. Appeared a little lazy there as well. Works for him when he times the ball, not so much now
145kph, right on the money - and it was swinging in towards off stump as well - tough ball to face for your first in international cricket. Fernando blocks superbly

got him! Duck on debut, Starc's got his customary wicket in the first over. Pitched on off stump at a good length, veered back in, hit high-ish on the pad, but that looked quite adjacent. Fernando was pinned to the crease, playing around his front pad, slow in doing so as well.
back of a length and outside off, at 145 kph, shoulders arms
beats him with a peach at 146 kph! Hits the deck, makes it bounce handsomely past the outside edge as Mendis tries his best to poke at "white thing," as Starc once called it
length, too far outside off, de Silva collects an extra
back of a length on and around off stump, de Silva taps it towards mid-on.
shortish and outside off, de Silva chops it into the covers
a bit of an inside edge to square leg as he blocks in front of off stump. Stark difference in pace - this at 125 kph.
slips down leg as de Silva tries a flick. Can't quite reach that far
another inside edge as the Duke bowls back of a length and just outside off. De Silva attempted a cut through cover.
that one seemed to stay low. Back of a length, outside off, wafts at it with very little footwork, mistimes to cover

shot! Now that was off the middle. And it was probably the hardest ball to hit off the middle on account of the extra bounce. Hastings digs it in and offers just a hint of room. De Silva gets up on his toes and slaps it through the covers.
good length ball outside off, teasing the drive, Mendis obliges and Starc beats the outside edge
thuds into his thigh pad before he was ready for it. 143 kph, shortish, angled into the body. Mendis tries a flick but he wasn't quick enough
falls short of the wicketkeeper. Faint under edge as de Silva cuts standing still. Misjudged the length there, wasn't there for the cut.
fuller ball outside off, pushed towards mid-off
sweet little flick to the right of mid-on. Khawaja had to dive, got to the ball, but couldn't hold on. Full, straight and de Silva plays one of his favourite shots
dug in short at 139 kph, on middle and leg, forces Mendis to duck underneath
gets forward to a good length ball outside off and blocks it well

width on offer and de Silva stands and delivers with a cut shot. He has a little back and across movement before the ball is bowled, which helps when the ball is short. Might make it a problem if the ball swings back in
back of a length on fourth stump, defended
his hair's already been torn out, so what could Hastings do now? genuine outside edge, but no slips. Good length ball, in the corridor, lazy drive, little reprieve
back of a length on middle and leg, de Silva lets it come on and flicks it behind square leg.
back of a length on off stump, defended towards gully
short, moving across the right-hander, Mendis guides it over point
full on off stump at 144 kph, de Silva keeps it out well. Seemed to have a lot of time to play that one. Getting used to conditions, perhaps
lines up the back of a length ball at 142 kph and slides it off the open face towards point
gets up on his toes to blunt a short delivery at 138 kph and on off stump
drilled into the covers. Starc was looking for the yorker on off stump, de Silva is confidently behind it.
beaten for pace there. It was a wide yorker at 141 kph, de Silva sought to slice it through point and misses
allows a back of a length ball outside off to go through to the keeper

big appeal for caught behind from the keeper, Wade wants to review, it but the bowler has no clue. Australia have gone for a check with the third umpire. There seems a noise, and a deviation as well when the ball passes the outside edge.  I'm not sure they use Snicko here as part of the DRS. But even without it, Mendis has been given, fair call from Aleem Dar. It was a good length ball in the off stump corridor. Had Mendis pushing at it. Held its line just enough to get the nick
beats him again. Beautiful line from Hastings. It's just back of a length, outside off, has Chandimal, the new batsman, reaching away from his body without much footwork
good length on off stump, defended
moves forward to the length ball, takes it from off stump and flicks it through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, defended
full, wide outside off at 146 kph, left alone
goes short on a fifth stump line. Chandimal sways away
145 kph, full, straight, looking to bully middle stump. Chandimal's straight bat comes through just in the nick of time.

142 kph, goes for the big, booming drive outside off, but the fuller ball goes on with the angle and beats the outside edge. Doesn't quite have the outswinger, but he does use his natural left-armer's angle superbly
excellent hit. It was a shortish delivery, forcing him up off his feet, but that doesn't rob him of balance. Head over the ball, bat close to the body, perfectly executed punch through the covers
full on leg stump at 142 kph, driven to mid-on

127 kph, carves it over point! Didn't quite time it perfectly, think it went off the high part of the bat, but he made sure it give it his all and hit it over the infield. There was no one there on the boundary
"will you take that one over the top," someone chirps at de Silva as he gives a good length ball the respect it deserves
a little uppish, but he has managed to keep the flick away from the vicinity of short fine leg. Went back, exploited the short ball on his pads
back of a length on off stump, blocks it with soft hands, looking for a single. Can't find it
takes on the short ball, even if he didn't quite have the room to free his arms. Forces the pull away to deep midwicket
gets across to a shortish delivery outside off and punches it to mid-off
fuller all on off stump at 134 kph, defended
fluent drive to cover. Takes the outside-off-stump ball on the up
moves it closer to off stump, Chandimal goes forward and blocks with a closed face
man right on the edge of the circle at cover point - and this short ball outside off is cut straight to him

won't be saving Sri Lanka this time. It's a length ball outside off, Chandimal wants to paste it through extra cover. Wasn't supposed to play it off the front foot with the length being reasonably short. The bounce does him, takes the edge and goes through to the keeper
138kph, on target to the new batsman, Mathews defends and protects off stump.
126 kph, gets back and across to punch to cover
appeal for lbw from Faulkner, as de Silva goes for a flick and misses. Umpire Gough knows that had pitched well outside leg stump
good length ball, pushed to mid-on
firm push off the back foot, and it had enough power to beat short cover, not mid-off.
slides down leg, attempts a flick and misses
full and outside off, driven to mid-off
good length ball on off stump, defended. Back-to-back maidens
full, straight, given a home in the vast open spaces at square leg. Lovely wristwork from Mathews
good length ball outside off, stands still, waits for the ball to come to him and drills it to mid-off
shot! Goes a little too full, a little too straight, possibly the same ball that Mathews flicks, de Silva smears down the ground.

he has flicked it pretty much to oblivion! Picked it up off a length and the roll of the wrists gives the ball so much power. Doesn't quite move his feet too much, but that somehow works in his favour. Great hand-eye coordination
back of a length on off stump, defended off the front foot
fuller ball outside off, defended into the covers
Whoa, what happened there? Mathews was pulling out of his stance, asking the bowler to stop. Faulkner doesn't. And Mathews plays a perfect little block in front of off stump
back of a length on off stump, kept out
full on off stump, defended well
back of a length on off stump, defended
clips it off his hips to deep square leg
shortish on off stump, de Silva moves across to it and hacks an open face down to run it through to third man
good bouncer from Boland, but it appears that took off a little too high for the square leg umpire's liking. Well over head height. Good call from Gough
back of a length and outside off, defended

a little late in bringing his bat down against the back of a length delivery, a shade outside off. Seemed to deck in off the seam. And plenty more bounce than de Silva thought. Inside edge while cutting, goes back to the keeper
gentle little touch to fine leg. Boland loses his line, targets the pads, de Silva gives it just a little bit of direction
short, outside off, carved to deep third man.

hit on the helmet and those back flaps protecting his neck fly off! Didn't spot the short ball early enough, and Boland lined it up well. On off stump, which is fine with Mathews moving back and across and covering all his stumps. Hit him flush, because he took his eyes off the ball while taking evasive action. Needs a little breather. Feels it against the side of his head.
that was bound to happen. Another short ball from Boland, this one is banged into the middle of the pitch, so Mathews is able to see it early and duck
back of a length on leg stump, de Silva nudges it off his hips to long leg. Played late, played well
solid hit down the ground, between the stumps and the non-striker. It's a short ball on off stump, met with a firm and straight bat
held its line and beats the edge! Faulkner had moved around the wicket for a back of a length ball outside off. Mathews attempts a lazy waft and comes up with nothing
powerful drive down the ground, Faulkner does well to dive across to his right in his followthrough and help mid-on field it
fuller ball on off stump, defended
short of a length on off stump, defended
starts with a full toss on leg stump, driven to long-on
lovely bowling. Loops it up at 73 kph, gets it to pitch on middle and spin just enough to make Mathews cautious
moves inside the line of the ball and drives to long-off. Lovely flight again
good bowling again. "Just bowl there," says Wade. Pitched full on off stump, de Silva defends with an open face to account for the turn
pushes at a tossed up delivery on leg stump, playing for the angle in at him, and gets a little leading edge to point.
driven to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, defended
good length ball on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
back of a length on off stump, defended

ripper! All that needed was the outside edge. Was pitched in the best spot to snag it too - on a good length, angled in from around the stumps, and then it straightens past the bat. Mathews made to play at an unplayable delivery
looks for the same magic as he spears it in on middle stump, but this time there is no movement and Mathews flicks to long leg
de Silva wanted to glide it to third man, off the back foot, but it was just a touch too full. Beaten.
went a little too far down leg, looking for some extra turn. Or maybe he underestimated the drift he's been getting

defended into the coveres, Warner is electric there, runs in, but began concentrating on the throw a touch too early. Can't pick up the ball one-handed and then his diving under-arm flick is in vain. Only ends up landing awkwardly
driven through the covers
flighted outside off, defended
tossed up on leg stump, Zampa moves across and just about stops it
went wide of the crease to bowl a loopy one on middle, Mathews gets inside the line and drives back to Zampa
gets a little turn after bowling it quicker - 86 kph - and flatter. Defended into the covers
good length ball just outside off, defended as late as he could.
fuller ball on the stumps, pushed down the ground
full and straightening on middle and off, defended cautiously
pushed to mid-on, and as he was hurrying to make his ground at the non-strikers' end, the throw comes in straight at his head! Unintentional, I think
good length ball on off stump, nudged effortlessly towards mid-on.
shot! It's back of a length on middle and leg, de Silva moves across to roll his hands on top of the ball and glance it to the right of short fine leg.
flighted outside off, driven to cover
"down, down" yelps Wade and Hastings at backward point does so. Mathews had gone deep in his crease for a cut shot. Just enough room for that, and he plays so late.
flighted outside off, drilled at Warner, who misfields at short cover
leans into a drive as a tossed up ball pitches just outside off. Lovely accuracy from Zampa
quicker and flatter on off stump, pushed to long-on
nearly beat him in flight. Mathews was lunging forward, but the tossed up ball dips on him and he has to roll his wrists on the ball to keep it down
clips a shortish delivery from outside off to deep square leg

bang he goes, running at the fast bowler and flicking him over his head. Back of a length ball turned into length, and then a whippy flourish gives it all the power it needed to soar over mid-on and mid-off
defended on a good length
banged in short on off stump, Mathews was thinking about a pull, then realised the ball was way over his head and he could get a wide for it if he leaves
on the pads, flicked away to long leg
pushed past mid-on
good length ball on off stump, defended
tossed up outside off, serenely driven to long-off to bring up his first ODI half-century. A handshake from his captain, a standing ovation from the dressing-room. He's got 50 of Sri Lanka's 76
shortish and outside off, cut towards cover
that's well bowled, and equally well played. Zampa seemed to beat him in the dip on off stump, Mathews lunging forward, has to adjust with his hands. Defends gently and pinches a single
drifts it in on the pads, clipped away towards fine leg
looped up on off stump, defended
flighted on middle, blocked
good length, outside off, de Silval is so confident in his hand-eye abilities that he waits on the back foot and glides it to deep third man. Wanted a second, his captain was nowhere near interested.
shortish on off stump, runs it down to third man
length ball, wants to slap it over extra cover, ends up being beaten. For once, he looks a bit ugly
lovely work from de Silva. Read the line and length beautifully. Waited just that extra second longer and plays a beautiful late cut to third man
beaten, as he was looking to dial up third man again. Could easily have nicked off, looking for at best a couple of runs

high, for the lbw appeal. Boland had pinned de Silva on the crease, and he was up on his toes as well, trying to play a flick. Struck on the pads, Warner waits, chats with everyone important and then chooses not to review

big appeal for lbw, but that was sliding down leg, I think. Zampa and Wade come up to have a chat and Warner goes for a reivew. That's the googly. Mathews is down the track, but his little flick comes out down the wrong line, is hit in front of leg stump, with the ball seeming to go further down. Review lost because Mathews had been down the pitch - more than 3 m - that means umpire's call and we don't have to look for the ball hitting the stumps. That's the rules, by the way. If the impact of ball on pad is more than 3 m from the crease, umpire's call is immediately upheld
flighted outside off, driven into the off side
tossed up on middle, Mathews moves to the leg side and pushes down the ground
a little short, Mathews jumps back and pulls. Mistimed to long-on
flighted on leg stump, clipped to square leg
good length ball on off stump, defended into the covers. Mathews sets off for a quick single, and is made to stretch because of a direct hit. Travis Head, the fielder. But the batsman is well home
good length ball on off stump, defended firmly
lands it really full and just outside off, steered towards point for a single
goes wide of the crease for a yorker on off stump, de Silva digs it out easily

excellent shot! Australia seem to be plying him with balls on the stumps, and he keeps tucking in. Might be because his back foot moves across in front off stump. But here de Silva is able to drag it back and flick the ball away fine of the man at long leg
leans into a flowing drive through the covers. Took it on the up and caresses it through the gap
steered behind point. No one looking for a single. De Silva is on one knee, pushing his bat back in his crease. It was well inside when the fielder decides to throw and make a direct hit
gets down the track and drives to long-off
beaten by the dip a bit. Mathews had come forward, but has to extend his arms to make sure he defends well
drags it down and the long hop has been pulled to the square leg boundary, off one knee.
short and wide outside off, slapped to deep point
flighted outside off, driven to long-off
well tossed up just outside off, Mathews blocks it
lovely channel just outside off from Starc. Has kept it there more often than not today. Solidly behind the line of that

not sure that is the best strategy but the exuberance of youth, or something like that. Rather overpitched outside off from Starc, DdS stays in his crease and lofts the ball over the bowler. Not great timing but enough to beat mid-off
looking for the yorker outside off, jammed out towards point.
wayward stuff again. Strays down leg at 140 kph to give SL a free run

just over cover. I'd still say that ain't great batting. Full outside off, the ball moving away ever so slightly. It was quite full so DdS goes through with a lofted drive and clears cover. Warner trots back from mid-off, but a fumble allows the third
better. Experience. Full and straight, dead-bat block. Play out the opposition's best
142 kph, rather full and wide outside off, a calm drive towards deep cover gets Mathews one. Nine off the over
gentle but accurate start. 126 kph, fullish outside off. Some inward movement, solidly blocked

goes for it and clears mid-off. Mathews scampers down and mis-times his heave down the ground. Cross-seam from Hastings, extracting some extra bounce. Off the upper half of the bat. Mid-off tracks it down
too straight this time and DdS helps it down to fine leg. Played that well, shuffled aross
good length on middle and leg, not much movement. De Silva walks across and nudges one to square leg

oh no, what has Mathews done? He may have done some damage to his right calf, big moment in the game. Clipped a straight delivery towards square leg and immediately hobbled towards the other end -limping and clutching his calf Mathews needs some treatment.
superb stroke. A half-volley outside off, crisply creamed to cover. Straight to the fielder. Languid drive
beaten. Fuller than a good length just outside off, Mathews wafts and misses, his feet nowhere near the pitch
nice start. Push and run to mid-on. Rather full from Boland, looking for the lbw.
good length outside off, comes back in gently. Carved to point. De Silva's innings gets more important
full and wide, de Silva nails a languid cover drive to deep cover. Lovely shot, uppish but safe
good length on off and middle, 127 kph. Blocked
129 kph, full and straight. Perera blocks towards midwicket
not a great shot again, but gets away with it. 133 kph, full on off. Sees the length and chooses to go over the infield. Skews off the outside half over point for a couple
back of a length outside off, tapped towards point. Is not happy he didn't get one
good length on off, nice lines. Whipped through square leg for one.
back of a length on middle and leg, 133 kph. Cramps Perera for room, solid
looked out with a direct hit. These Sri Lanka players testing their luck. Pushed to Warner at mid-off, who hurtled towards the ball, picked up but fired an inaccurate throw to the non-strikers end

there is the wicket. Always looked on the cards the way he was playing. Short length outside off, de Silva chooses the wrong shot. Tries to drag a pull from outside off, the ball gets big on him and he ends up spooning a catch to midwicket. Was never going to be in control of that stroke. Quality innings, but a lot more could have achieved after that start. Hastings is pumped, Australia hitting back
another loose, uppish drive outside off. Full and wide, Angelo caresses a drive to the sweeper cover
full and wide outside off, 130 kph. Kusal lunges forward and outside-edges a single to third man
well played. Lets the ball come to him before deflecting the length delivery off the open face to third man
131 kph, keeping it outside off, quite full. Steered to point. Loud yelps of no
full and wide outside off, 133 kph. Kusal throws his hands at it, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket. Looks all over for the ball. Bailey picks it up and moves to gully
well bowled. Full outside off, 127 kph - gentle pace. Kusal is beaten on the outside edge
tapped towards point. A lot of hesitation but the run is made in the end
good length outside off from around the wicket, pushed to cover.
125 kph, outside off, creamed to deep cover
short, loopy bouncer on off at 130 kph. Angelo gets under that
good call of no. 131 kph on middle and leg, pushed down to mid-on. The fielder is quick on it to prevent the run
shortish and wide, width, and flayed through cover point for a run
overpitched outside off, Angelo comes down and drills a drive to mid-off
much straighter this time - on middle and off. Clipped towards midwicket
drags the length back on middle, easily nudged to square leg. Just the one
full toss on off, Kusal comes down and pats a full toss to cover. Could have done more with that, get off strike at worst
nicely tossed up on off, blocked
88 kph, full outside off. Kusal dances down and drives to long-off, gets one, played with the turn
starts with some loop on leg, shortish length though. Kusal goes back and works to square leg. Well played
flat and wide outside off, chopped to point. "Nice, nice" says Wade

another poor stroke and Zampa gets his first. SL unravelling. Pitches on leg, spins towards off. Short enough for Angelo to play the pull, but he went right back and looked to hit that too hard. Gets a top edge which is easily taken by Wade running around towards square leg. Planning - check. Execution - a big red cross.
flatter on middle and leg, clipped to square leg for a single
81 ks, played with the spin to square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, worked away to midwicket
runs to the pitch of the ball and drives with the spin to long-off.
"hit the right side of the bat, Heady" screams Wade. Flight on middle, driven with the spin to long-off. Off the outside half
flat on off, blocked

one more. Kusal has to go. Terrible stroke. Sri Lanka are not helping themselves. Flight on off, Kusal comes to the pitch and bunts a catch straight to cover. Did not look to go over cover, did not bother with keeping that down. Ended up chipping his wicket away
nicely bowled, flat on off, solidly blocked
shortish outside off, comes in with the arm this time. Cut to deep point.
flight overpitched on off, driven to midwicket
nicely played. "I like it when they come down Zampy," says Wade. Pathirana uses his feet and drives to long-on
tossed up on middle and leg, solidly blocked
poor delivery. Dragged down from Zampa, sits up for Perera to belt through cover. Made use of that length, got back and muscled a drive to the cover boundary

spin, beats everyone. Four byes, runs, crucial runs. Slow through the air, Perera goes back and tries to cut one from leg stump. What kind of a shot was that? Was nowhere near the ball, even Wade was taken aback by that stroke and missed it altogether
slides on with the arm, full outside off, draws Thisara forward, the ball goes past the edge
short and wide outside off, almost called. Wayward. Still does not look happy with those footholds
tail, comes back in sharply. Just misses the pads and deviates down leg for a free run. Pathirana has got to watch for those yorkers.
yorker, but slightly mid-directed - outside off. Jammed out
nicely played. Full and wide outside off, driven to mid-off
another yorker that darts down leg, wide. But deadly bowling, just missed his line. Feigned a slower ball.
comes back in again, full on off, 145 kph. Blocked. Nicely behind the line
plays that well. Gets his bat well in front of his body fro the ball darting back in, but the ball is wide so he plonks a drive to cover. Opened the face to get one
too wide, the third in the over. Short and wide this time. Thisara thinks of cutting but rightly bails out late.
good length on off, a checked punch to Warner at cover
full outside off, Pathirana opens the face to guide towards point. "No," screams Thisara. There was one there because Bailey had to get across from backward point
132 kph, full and straight. Solidly blocked
good single. Full on off, pushed to mid-off. Pathirana sets off immediately, makes it with ease. Warner doesn't pick up, naughtily throws the ball into the surface
full and wide outside off, Thisara goes after it but misses. Beaten on the outside edge
badly times a drive to mid-off. Full and wide outside off, Thisara does not move his feet
short, bouncer. Thisara gets underneath. Just one off the over
full and wide from Starc, SP gives it everything he has. Misses his drive, beaten on the outside edge
nicely bowled, looking for the inswinging yorker on off. Driven to mid-on with the angle
full and straight, solidly blocked. Not a bad option at all, keep out Starc. Besides, this could be his last over of the spell
a slow full toss on leg is nudged to square leg to bring up SL's 150

nice. Gets a poor ball, a full toss on middle. Perera chooses the best option there is, punches the ball through mid-on. Not overhit, not swinging across the line. Full face of the bat and mid-on can't get across
excellent from Thisara. Full and straight, just keeps it out.
full outside off, moves away late. Pathirana chips a drive over cover for one
ooh, stops in the surface. Back of a length on middle, sticks in the pitch. Perera bunts it back. Has a grin
good stroke, good all, good fielding. Overpitched outside off, Perera times his drive to mid-off where Warner scurries across to his left and cuts it off
nice bowling. Changes the length, short on middle and leg. Perera ducks underneath

dropped. Bailey drops an absolute sitter. Short and wide outside off, Perera throws his hands at that and carves his cut straight  o Bailey at point. Bailey stayed in his position, the ball dipped on him and he didn't look like he even got a hand on it. Poor footwork, may have through it was coming quicker than it was
bouncer on middle, Perera ducks undeneath
edged for four. lucky, but vital runs. Full and wide outside off, Pathirana looks to carve it through point but gets an outside edge which whistled away past short third man
slower ball, back of the hand. Spins away late and beats Pathirana's attempted dab to third man
and again, back-of-the-hand slower ball outside off, Pathirana opens his bat face to get one to third man
ooh, the slower ball rips off the pitch. Full on off, the break on the slower ball beats Perera's bat.
low full toss on off, bunted to mid-off for one
another short and wide slower ball. Pathirana looks to cut but the ball beats the bat. Run-scoring is getting harder on this surface
slower ball on off, sits up for Perera to punch straight to cover.
130 kph, short and wide outside off, slapped to mid-off from the back foot
chopped towards point for a quick single. Australia's seamers using pace off the ball regularly
full on middle and leg, tapped to midwicket
beaten on the outside edge. Full outside off, the ball moves away late and beats the bat
136 kph, full on off. Pathirana opens the bat face to guide a run towards cover point.

not given. Massive appeal. None of the Australian players have happy faces. Slower ball outside off, Pathirana looks to clear mid-off with a lofted drive. I heard a noise when ball passed bat. But tough for umpire Gough to hear that. Australia have themselves to blame with a terrible review early on
another big swing, another slower ball that darts away, another miss
beats the bat again. This was pitched on off, the ball moves away very late and somehow misses off stump
four in a row. The fourth slower ball that spins prodigiously. Pathirana has no idea, beaten again
gets low, another short slower ball outside off. Pathirana dabs one to third man. Sensational bowling this
117 kph, another slower ball. The sixth in succession. But this is straight and Perera flicks to deep midwicket, just one.
slower, short ball on middle. Perera backs away and slaps a cut to cover. Avoiding hitting into the leg side, like he did last match

oh no, he has lobbed a catch to Finch at cover. Another poor stroke, neither here nor there. Short, slow ball outside off. Perera backs away and tries to hit that through point, but the slowness of the surface means he ends up slapping a catch to cover.
good length on off, solid block to cover, 123 kph.
good length outside off, Dilruwan tries to open the face to guide to third man but misses.
legcutter outside off, 118 kph. Carved to point. Another dot
nicely played. Short and wide outside off, Dilruwan guides one through gully for a run to third man
beauty. Good length on off from around the wicket, Dilruwan plays the line but the ball moves away late. Beaten
ooh, full on leg, Dilruwan sees an opportunity to clip through square leg but the ball shapes away late, takes the leading edge to third man. Will always get that shape with this angle
well played. Back of a length on off, Pathirana opens the face and guides one to third man
full and straight, zoning in on off stump. Solid block to cover
full and straight, worked to square leg for one. Nice batting, getting what they can
oh my. Five free runs for SL. 146 kph, looking for the yorker but gets it wrong. Goes down leg and once it pitches behind the wicket, Wade always had no chance.

and this is the edge for four to the third man boundary. 12 off the over, massive. Good length outside off, Pathirana gets a thick outside edge and it flies away through the cant slip region. Actually, looked like he wanted to get that to third man. More off the outside half than the edge
slower ball on middle and leg, nudged to square leg, one. Good result for SL
knows exactly what's coming, the slower ripping ball outside off, he gets low and dabs a run to third man
the quicker one outside off, 126 kph. Passes the outside edge
good running, dabs a slower ball to point and sets off immediately. Makes it, a direct hit from bailey would have had Dilruwan

well played, two more. Overpitched that slower ball outside off, Pathirana opens the face and gets it over cover for a couple more. Hit a good spot in the ground. A puff of dust as ball made contact with the surface
another slower delivery outside off, timed to cover
nicely played. Overpitched outside off, crisply driven to deep cover to get one
spearing yorker on off, somehow Pathirana gets bat on it and inside-edges his block to fine leg. A fantastic result for SL
shot! Rather full and wide outside off, smashed to deep over who gets across, knocks it on and allows two.
gets too straight this time and Perera helps it to the fine leg boundary with some sublime batting. Did not go after it, just got bat on that. Played it fine and picked up four for his effort.
138 kph. Unplayable. Finally, gets his line and length right. Full outside off, Dilruwan plays the line but the ball moves away late and beats the bat
too straight again, flicked to deep midwicket for one. The pair think of two, but decide against it. A really good over for Sri Lanka

gets it through cover point for more runs. Slower ball outside off, Dilruwan chips it into the off side and the ball falls in a safe place behind point. Surely did not intend that but he won't care. Gets one
slower delivery outside off, 111 kph. Pushed towards cover for one, excellent batting. Bat on ball gets one
107 kph, slower delivery outside off, Dilruwan swings across the line but misses. Shadow practices the drive after the fact
nice, clipped to deep backward square leg for one. Too straight from Faulkner
another slower ball outside off, 104 kph. Pathirana plays too late, mis-times a powerful drive to long-0off
another slower delivery outside off, squirted to long-on for one. Another good over for Sri Lanka

gets him. Hastings bangs one in with a cross-seam delivery banged in on a short length. Dilruwan was through the stroke too early and gets a thin outside edge to Wade. More signs of the slow surface as Dilruwan was through his pull early
slower bouncer on leg, Mathews misses his pull.
short, slower ball on off. Pulled to midwicket, Mathews can't run
slow short delivery on middle and leg, helped along to deep square leg. Mathews hobbles up to the other end. 200 up.
slower ball on middle and leg, carved to backward point. Bailey is close, he needn't be

gone. Pathirana holes out to long-off. Not a good shot again. Slower ball outside off, Pathirana goes back in his crease and chips a catch to long-off. Hastings gets five, his best ODI bowling figures
slower ball on off, blocked
full delivery outside off, Aponso drives to long-off. Mathews limps across to the other end . This could be a telling stand if they could cobble up something
117 kph, good length and straight, blocked out to cover
he gets four. Sloppy fielding from Finch at long-on. Overpitched on middle and leg, Mathews backs away and belts one down the ground, Finch scurries across but the ball goes underneath his hands
shortish delivery outside off, slapped away to point
not a bad over at all for Sri Lanka. Six crucial runs. Another slower ball on middle, carved out to long-on. He gets across just in time
short delivery on leg, pulled into the ground to deep midwicket. Mathews opts not to run.
another bouncer on off, Mathews tries to pull but is way too late on it. Hastings stares at Mathews, Mathews writhes in pain
four more. A slow short bouncer on middle and leg, sits up for Mathews to dispatch through midwicket. Mathews backs away, and hammers his pull through midwicket. Great batting
looks for the upper cut. Short delivery on leg, Mathews knows what's coming, backs away and misses his upper cut. A cry of anguish because third man was up
overpitched outside off, Mathews walks across and chips this over cover. Almost makes the boundary, head prevents it by running across but Mathews gets back for two.

taken at backward point. Hastings gets six. Mathews' brave effort ends. Could be a crucial 12 runs these. Short delivery on off, very high. Mathews shuffles across and goes after that but only ends up splicing a skied catch to Bailey. Mathews hobbles off.

inn2.comm: 132 kph, that's not a bad start. Thisara goes full and straight, Warner digs it out of the blockhole
good bowling. He's targeting middle stump, angling the ball away. Warner closes the face of his bat a touch and gets a bit of a leading edge
the line goes wrong here, and Warner would feel aggrieved that he couldn't put that away. The length was juicy for the flick, but Warner misses it and it flicks the pad
checks his shot - he was looking for the punch through cover, but held back
beaten on the inside edge! Lovely bowling from Thisara. Threw it wider for the drive, but the movement he manages to extract makes sure Warner is trumped
has him falling over as he bowls full on middle, the angle of the ball makes sure Warner's flick results in a leading edge to point
goes for the sweep immediately, huge appeal for leg before from the bowler and the wicketkeeper. Impact well outside off. The ball wanders away, no one looking after it, to the third man boundary

got a hand on it, was that Thisara? Sprinted to his left, then realised he has to backtrack, leaps up with one hand, but ends up palming it away. Misjudged it, just for a few seconds and that's all it needed to give a life. Probably had a little more time than he thought too. Finch went for the booming hit over extra cover, skews it in the other direction
jumps back and laces the backfoot punch through point. Good on Finch to keep the bat straight with Aponso's ability to bowl a very accurate arm ball
bang! Positions himself beside the ball, which pitched on middle and leg, and carves it over extra cover. High, handsome, powerful
good work from short fine leg as Finch goes for a sweep - concentrates on placement, nearly got it through the man.
backs away, gets a flat, quick delivery on leg stump, thumps it to long-off
on the pads to the right-hander, Finch clips it to deep square leg
outside edge as he slashes outside off stump, carries to the third man boundary
full on off stump, Finch strides forward and hammers the ball down the ground. Loves the ball coming onto the bat. Beefy hit

deal with that if you bowl me a half-volley! Australia know when the ball gets soft, and the spinnes take over in the middle overs, run-scoring will be hard. So Finch takes on everything. Massive hit, straight as well
deftly turned around to deep square leg. And the throw is awful. Doesn't have any power on it. Comes dribbling into the wicketkeeper and a risky double becomes oh so easy
stands and delivers a slap into the covers. Went short and wide there, Thisara, but the lack of pace helped him
reverse swatted him! A fairly decent delivery - tossed up outside off - but Warner bests it with a spurt of unorthodoxy
gets down the track, reaches the pitch of the ball, and slices it over cover. In the gap, so he could hit it in the air if he likes
steps down the track to a good length ball on off stump, moved himself outside the line of it so he could exploit the gap at midwicket
three men at point on the edge of the circle, so the cut shot, no matter how late he played it, wouldn't have beaten the ring
heaved away over long-on! That's the Australian 50 up in the fourth over! Lurches down the track, met the ball at its pitch on a good length, and simply demolishes it

seemed to make room on the leg side, so Aponso speared it into the pads, by which time Finch had magicked himself outside off and swept it away to the fine leg boundary. Moves to 43 off 14 now. the fastest ODI 50 is in 16 balls

skewed off the outside half of the bat, the 18-year old Avishka is running after it from point, trying to get under it, but he can't. Came down the track too early and Dilruwan pushed the ball wide of his reach

beautiful reverse sweep. There was barely any room for him to use his hands. It was full and angled in from around the stumps on middle. He has such good hands and had kept his eyes firmly on the ball to set himself up
goes back and cuts to cover
would have been out if that had been a direct hit. Hit to mid-off, ran with the shot, though he was at full-stretch, he wouldn't have made it
he's on course for the fastest fifth in ODI cricket! Made room, took the half-volley and biffed it over long-off

missed it! He won't have the fastest fifty in ODI cricket, but he might have a shot at the Australian record - that is 18 balls. Loopy delivery on off stump, just the kind he had bashed before, but here I think his weight was a little on the back foot, as he tries to heave the ball over extra cover. The ball beats the inside edge and wanders past the keeper
moves back to the leg side and punches into the covers
has equalled the fastest fifty by an Australian! Took on a length ball on middle and swept it away over deep square leg. Massive strike.

Pathirana pleads and pleads and pleads and finally umpire Palliyaguruge says yes. Finch given lbw, but he reviews. Pushed through on middle, Finch went for the premeditated sweep, his front foot was across, and he was hit on the edge of his front pad. Hit well in line. But would that go on to knock over leg stump? Oh, HawkEye says it would just clip it! The ball and the stump are almost tangential! The finest of margins, working in Sri Lanka's favour
good length ball, Khawaja goes back and clips to short fine leg

two in the over! Khawaja stands, looks down, and walks off forlornly. This is tossed up on off stump, beats the inside edge of the prodding bat and thuds into the front pad. Right in front of middle, should be hitting leg, Pathirana screams, but no one can here him because all of Dambulla are screaming as well. Oh wait, HawkEye says that would be missing. There is plenty of turn out there, but that looked out to the naked eye...
nudged away through cover
bends his leg to get low to the flatter ball on leg stump and taps it into the covers. Quick single taken as the fielder doesn't pick up the ball
goes down for the sweep, rolls his wrists over the ball and picks the gap past short fine leg. Australia are sticking to that shot

reverse sweeps to the cover point boundary! How has he timed that? It pitched well outside leg, it would be turning further down that direction. Hit against the turn, hit with very little leverage to work with
another reverse sweep, this one from leg stump, the bat comes down in a punishing arc, meets the ball almost at the pitch and the power in the stroke is good enough to hit the point boundary again
down the track this time over long-on! Dilruwan had pulled his length back, but the batsman must have guessed that. Hared at him and flicks him away
pushed through on leg stump, Bailey was almost tumbling over when he manages to thrust his bat in line with the ball with one hand and dab it away to fine leg

that is superb! Warner steps down the track, but he can't get to the pitch of the ball. Lovely flight, and then it dips on the batsman. So beautiful Warner tries to push at the ball, having originally planned to slam it down the ground. He doesn't know how much it would turn. He doesn't know what to do. Ends up defending inside the line and the ball beats his outside edge to crash into his stumps
goes back and flicks to short leg, great work from Mendis, moving quickly to his left and dives to prevent the single
flighted on off stump, clipped to short leg
pitches a little short and just outside off, Head waits in his crease and watches the ball turn big down the leg side
flighted outside off, driven into the covers, excellent work with Chandimal diving to his right
slow, a little short, Head can hang back and work it behind square leg
tossed up on middle, comes forward and nudges it through midwicket
goes back and cuts to deep third man. That's Australia's hundred, in the ninth over. May well be their fastest in one-day cricket
stays put on middle, clipped through midwicket
top shot! Flays at the width on offer - and it was short as well - all he had to do was pick the gap at point
good length and outside off, clunks it to point
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
beaten on the outside edge as Head goes for a cover drive on the up
flighted onto leg stump, Bailey moved to the leg side for a cover drive, but the dip beats him. Makes the ball pitch on this worn surface, makes it turn and take the outside edge
how did that miss the off stump?! Bailey was batting on leg stump, he lunges forward blindly, is beaten for the turn. Looked ripe to topple the stump, it looks worse in slow motion...
again, him batting on leg stump against Pathirana will not work. Pushes at the ball, guessing where it would be, but it turns wildly past the edge
poor ball there... Drags it short, Bailey is good enough to jump back and hammer it through the covers
pushes forward, this time he gets to the pitch, blocks it
pushed into the covers, fairly gingerly
flatter delivery outside off, hacked to mid-off. Wanted to cut, but there was too much turn and the bat face turned in his hand
came forward on off stump, but the length wasn't there, so he goes back and nudges it behind square leg
beats point with the reverse sweep! Tossed up on off stump, blitzed away. So much power in the shot that the fielder barely had the chance to see the ball
shortish delivery, turning sharply outside off, Bailey set up for the cut and ends up leaving it
falls short of the bowler! Bailey had gone back and slapped this straight at Aponso, who dives forward, hoping to redeem himself, but can't quite get under the ball

appeal for a stumping, and umpire Palliyaguruge asks for some help. Poor appeal from Kusal. Bailey's back foot was perfectly ground and perfectly safe. Big turn again from a left-arm spinner, and the off stump somehow manages to avoid its wrath. Bailey defending down the wrong line again
flighted on off stump, defended

huge appeal, Kusal Mendis is right in front of the umpire's face, yelling and flinging his hands up in the air for a catch at short leg. Palliyaguruge says no, Chandimal goes for a review. He will lose it. It's a good length ball to which Head had come down the track for a flick. The turn beat the inside edge, no glove, straight off the pad. Now they look to check the lbw. Impact was in line, but the turn would have taken the ball down leg
a little short in length which allows Head to go back and flick to deep midwicket
tossed up on middle, swept to the right of deep square leg
flighted on off stump, defended

excellent strike! It was tossed up on off stump, Bailey runs at it, takes it on the full and hammers it over mid-on. Picked the spot where the fielder wasn't there, toyed with the bowler's length after Pathirana had previously toyed with his judgment of line. Revenge is sweet
short and wide outside off, cut to deep point
tossed up outside off, Bailey pushes forward and pads it more or less
picked the shorter length early and clips it through to deep midwicket
stays back to a flatter delivery on off stump and gets an inside edge as he decides between attack and defence
outside edge past slip! Slowed it down nicely, got it to drift in on leg stump, made Head prod in front of his body and the turn does the rest
flighted outside off, serenely driven to the right of long-off
drags it short, and Bailey makes sure he picks the gap. Cracking cut shot to the left of the man in the deep. And despite the fielder's big dive, the ball trickles away
turn, bounce, beaten. It was a touch short, Bailey went back to try and push it through the covers, then he sees the turn and tries to check his shot. Doesn't succeed
beaten, can't do much with that. He plays the original line of the ball, pushing forward to block. He won't be able to reach the pitch, but the thing he does well is not follow the turn.
gets down the track and drives back to the bowler
lunges forward on off stump, defended
pushes down the track, Pathirana darts the ball wider, Bailey manages to push his bat in line with the ball and avoid being stumped

bowled him! natural variation! Oh wait, he's overstepped! Had hurtled down the pitch, making room to hit the offspinner inside out. But the ball squirts in through the bat and pad gap to topple middle stump. Apparently that is the first no-ball of the series. A quick drink for the two batsman while the third umpire was checking on the front foot. Bailey pats Head on the arm, to get him going again.
comes down the track, Dilruwan drags the line further outside off, makes the batsman reach. Head slaps it down to long-off, who misfields and Bailey is ready to capitalise on it. Great running
good length ball on off stump, doesn't turn much. Head defends cautiously, waiting for the pitch to do its bit
tossed up on middle and off, defended firmly
flighted on off stump, Head follows the ball with his bat and gets the outside edge towards point
takes a flighted delivery outside off and whips it to long-on
again, follows the ball as it turns sharply past him. Gets an outside edge past slip. Manages to keep it down nonetheless. That's drinks
flighted on off stump, drives to cover
presses forward to block in front of off stump
back of a length and outside off, punches through the covers
flighted outside off, comes down the track and blocks
moves back to a length ball, looking to flick, but is put in a little trouble while doing so because of the sharp turn
sweetly driven to long-off. Bailey's getting more and more comfortable at the crease. Getting to the pitch of the ball more often than not
goes for the reverse sweep, takes it from well outside leg stump. He's doing this really well. The spinners, though there is plenty of help, are not allowed to hit the lengths they want
jumps back to a ball only slightly short, hurries into a cut shot, and he somehow manages to slice the ball past short third man
flighted on off stump, driven firmly to long-off. That's the fifty partnership
flighted outside off, Bailey comes forward to block
flat in trajectory, short in length, turning down leg. One of the easier deliveries Bailey has to face on tour. Pulls it to long leg
opens the face to a good length ball outside off and finds point
shortish and outside off, Bailey backs away and cuts to deep third man
flighted on middle and leg, defended
gets forward to block, but he couldn't get to the pitch of the ball and ends up with an outside edge
comes down the track, takes it on the full and drives to long-off . That's his half-century as well, off 40 balls. Superb knock
goes back to a length ball, lets it turn into him and flicks it behind square leg
that's what he's done so well all innings. Getting those boundaries away. This is short, begging to be hit and Bailey puts it out of its misery through midwicket
goes back and punches to long-on
sweeps a good length ball on middle stump to long leg. That time he did not premeditate. Read the line, length and played it well
rocks back and punches the flatter ball back and the bowler
goes back and punches the short delivery to long-on
goes for a push into the covers, but the ball dips on him, goes on with the angle and wanders to long leg
flighted on middle, defended gently
tossed up and drifting in onto off stump, Bailey lashes a cover drive and gets a bottom edge
strides down the pitch, but once he realises he can't get to the ball on the full, he makes sure to defend with bat and pad close together
digs out this loopy ball on middle
plants his bat in front of pad and defends the flighted delivery on middle
good length ball outside off, left alone
short and outside off, cut to deep cover
flighted outside off, defended
goes for the reverse sweep and pulls a lot of dust out of the pitch. Also makes sure to hit the ball to point
comes down the track and hits mid-on

poor fielding. Bailey could not time the reverse sweep because he had premeditated the shot and the bowler had pulled his length back. Had to get over the bounce, couldn't do so well enough. Mistimes it, and yet the point fielder can't do much about it
goes back and pats it to long-on
beautiful drive! Head over the ball, body to the leg side to open up the region he was looking for and the angled bat threads the ball through the covers
flighted on leg stump, turned to midwicket
seems keen to step down the pitch, but Aponso doesn't allow that. Makes him defend on off stump
good length ball on off stump, defended
goes back and hurriedly punches one that goes straight
flighted on leg stump, worked away to long-on
stays back, seems fine even when the ball darts back in at him from the left-arm orthodox spinner, drills it to long-on. Bailey playing a knock he would remember for a while yet
hit in the air, towards short midwicket. The fielder dives across to his left, but had no chance in reaching that.

ooooh, almost knocks it back at the bowler!  The ball held in the pitch and though he checks his shot. Couldn't do so quite as well as he would live. De Silva moves to his right, dives forward but couldn't get his hands underneath it in the end. Tough chance
goes back and punches to long-off
goes for the reverse sweep, but finds point
now for the conventional sweep, and he does it gently to make sure the ball runs away fine
looped up outside off, firmly defended
flighted down the leg side, Head looks to nudge it fine, doesn't connect
drilled back down the pitch, Aponso tries to get down to it, but can't quite hold on. Misfield doesn't cost him
comes down the track and slaps it back at the bowler
extra bounce, but Head handles it well. Pitched outside off, had the batsman moving back for a flick. Does well to soften his hands and jam it down to the ground
flighted on off stump, defended
tossed up on off stump, driven back at Aponso
overpitched on off stump, Bailey knocks it down to long-on
short and wide, Head slaps it down to long-on. Not perfectly timed, but that's okay
short, and Bailey picks it up early and tonks it through towards the midwicket boundary. Needed a great effort from the man there, running hard and diving to his right to stop the boundary
flighted on middle, whipped to midwicket again, off the front foot
good length ball outside off, defended
flight outside off, a hint of turn, skewed into the off side
runs to the pitch of the ball, gets there but the ball still spins enough for the ball to squirt to deep cover off the outside half
nice, runs down to the pitch and drives to long-on with the spin
ooh, gets low for the reverse but the ball isn't full enough, has enough of space to bounce over Bailey's reverse
pushed towards cover for one
good fielding, Head comes down and drives towards midwicket who prevent the run with a dive

tripe. A terrible start, a rank long-hop on off. Bailey picks up the length early, goes back in his crease and hammers the pull to deep midwicket. The fielder runs across from midwicket but can't haul it in
flat and wide, a hint of turn. Left alone
flight outside off, bailey comes down and drives towards cover
the slider, Quick through the air, short and wide. Scythed but straight to point
poor delivery again, short and wide outside off. Sits up, Bailey stretches out and slaps to deep cover
flight on middle and off, played with the turn to midwicket
nice, flight, loop and drift on middle, the perfect mix. Skids on with the arm and takes the inside edge towards fine leg
sees the flight early, steps down and drills a run to long-on
slow on off, spin. Good pace, good direction. Forces Bailey to respectfully block
uses his feet, drives to cover who fumbles and allows the run
slow through the air, short. Turned to short leg who fires a throw to the non-strikers end. The bowler fumbles and allows the one

84 kph, yikes. How did that miss? Another one for Bailey. Shortish outside off, most of those have been turning in all evening but this one skids on. Almost takes out off stump. Misses by not too much
short and wide, plenty of spin but easily cut to deep point. Got on top of the bounce there
shapes for the reverse, this one pitches on leg and goes on further down. Bailey reverse slaps to cover
gets down for the conventional sweep and hammers his pull to deep backward square leg
shortish and wide outside off, slapped past cover for more runs

gone this time! Head is lbw, trapped plumb in front. This one doesn't spin, Head plays for some. Flat through the air on off, the ball skids on and beats Head on the inside edge. No hesitation at all, gone.
tossed up outside off, no turn. Wade strides forward to block
another reverse lap for four. Premeditates the reverse, gets a wide delivery and bailey just helps it along to the third man boundary. Easy.
flat on middle, skids on. Blocked
oh, ripping turn. Pitches on off, draws Bailey forward and then spins viciously away. Even Bailey claps him
flat on middle, thick inside edge towards midwicket
flat on off, Wade gets low and sweeps to fine leg
nice again, dances down and gets to the pitch and drives to long-off, wide long-off for a couple more
short and wide outside off, scythed to deep point for one
shot! Four more. Sublime batting, gets low and Bailey hammers it through backward square leg. Placed that beautifully. Knew what he was doing all along
reverse swept to third man
false shot, but he gets away with it. The right idea, but Dilruwan pulled his length back, Bailey dances down but doesn't get there. Clips the pad, and then past the keeper
blocked off the front foot

there it is. Australia complete the series win Flight from Dilruwan, Wade gets underneath the length and lofts the ball way over long-on. Wade is pumped, hugs Bailey, who has played an absolute blinder. Bailey picks up a couple of stumps. Wade does so too.
